title:
Diagnostic results of new-generation dispersive element test samples
  based on Bragg structures in fused silica
authors:
Anton I. Gorokhov, Evgeny A. Perevezentsev, Mikhail R. Volkov, and
  Ivan B. Mukhin
abstract:
A comprehensive diagnostics of new-generation dispersive elements based on
Bragg structures was completed. The influence of inscription parameters on the
properties of samples was studied and a threshold inscription intensity of ~
6.38 TW/cm2 at which the linear absorption coefficient as well as the phase and
polarization stresses sharply increase was found. When inscription is made with
an average intensity below the threshold, the linear absorption in dry silica
samples remains at a level of 10-5 cm-1, which is approximately two orders of
magnitude lower than that of currently available commercial samples. The
measured values of the dispersion characteristics using a white light
interferometer coincided are in a good agreement with the calculated values
provided by the manufacturer. The results of the diagnostics show that the
new-generation dispersive elements are promising for compressing kilowatt-level
radiation of average power.
